alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:28AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pike, northwestern Bullock, southwestern Macon and central Montgomery Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 928 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Snowdoun, or 9 miles south of Montgomery, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Montgomery, Union Springs, Meadville, Pike Road, Pine Level, Dublin, Franklin Field, Beans Crossroads, Hardaway, Snowdoun, Sprague, Shopton, Sellers, Pinedale, Ramer, High Ridge, Carters Hill, Barachias, China Grove and Mitchell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
